> <OLD>
>
> WASPINATOR buzzed through the air, even as the PREDACON reinforcements
> arrived.
>
> AT this point, the Inferno itself seemed ready.  BLACKARACHNIA still poised
> in the shadows of the trees, keeping locks on the numerous Maximals as VICE
> GRIP had disengaged slightly, working over now with DRILL BIT in digging
> underneath the ground and burrowing.
>
> DINOBOT smirking, "Why, is taht not your own soldiers upon your orders who
> are continuosly harrassing us now?  Truly, I expected some semblance of
> dignity, at least from the Rodent.  Him I expected to have a smidgen of
> awareness of the crisis.  But, if he is quite happy to mock us when you have
> called us, then I doubt there is any crisis at all if he's quite happy to
> instigate a fight and back up those who do.  You wish to cooperate, keep
> your own force sin line."

<NEW>

LEO stood facing DINOBOT, his face serious his own anger obvious in
his bright optics, but held at bay by the force of his will.
"Maximals, stand down." he said again. He looked at DINOBOT, "You will
keep your troops in line as well." He glanced up as the other
Predacons were moving in. He glanced over at HYDRAS, wondering when or
even if the PREDACON leader would do anything about his troops.

"With me." LEO said with a dramatic flare worthy of a PRIME. He turned
and walked back towards the center of the clearing where they had
originally been having the discussion with HYDRAS, perhaps distance
would allow things to simmer down.

LEO PRIME was having the distinct impression that this truce was not
going to last, and he was not sure if he could hold it together long
enough to get to TUSCON. At least so long as HYDRAS refused to keep
his men in check.

(TAG)

Preston
